intro: Libanotis daucoides, commonly known as the rock fennel, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots, parsley, and dill. The plant is characterized by its slender, aromatic stems and small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in umbels. Its leaves are finely divided and have a distinctive, spicy scent. Libanotis daucoides is often found growing on rocky slopes and in dry, sunny environments.
